questions.question_text: Which of the following details is NOT provided in any output from the netstat utility?
Which of the following commands can be used to display the local routing table? (Choose TWO correct answers.)
Which of the following is true about IPv6?

discussion.content:
A. With IPv6, the TCP port numbers of most services have changed.
B. IPv6 no longer supports broadcast addresses.
E. For IPv6, UDP and TCP have been replaced by the Rapid Transmission Protocol RTP.

These statements are false. In IPv6, the TCP and UDP port numbers of services remain unchanged and both protocols are still used. IPv6 supports both multicast and unicast addresses, though broadcast addresses are no longer used. IPv4 addresses cannot be used directly in IPv6; they must be mapped into IPv6 addresses using a technique such as IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses or translated using a Network Address Translation-Protocol Translation (NAT-PT) mechanism.

choices.A: With IPv6, the TCP port numbers of most services have changed.
choices.E: For IPv6, UDP and TCP have been replaced by the Rapid Transmission Protocol RTP.
choices.B: IPv6 no longer supports broadcast addresses.
choices.D: IPv6 no longer supports multicast addresses.
choices.C: IPv4 addresses can be used without any change with IPv6.

choices.A: The default route is always used first. When the default route is not available more specific routes are tried.
choices.C: The default route is only used if there is not a more specific route to a destination host or network.
choices.D: Without a default route, no network communication even in directly attached networks is possible.
choices.B: When a default route is set, all other routes are disabled until the default route is deleted.

discussion.content: C. The default route is only used if there is not a more specific route to a destination host or network.

questions.question_text: What is true regarding a default route?

discussion.content: A and C are valid lines in the file /etc/hosts.
